name: Vans Hawaiian Pro 2004
description:
Hawaiian Randy Rarick was in Ireland for the Quiksilver Masters contest at Bundoran in 2000 & spotted Barry's posters about the place. The first poster by Barry for the  Triple Crown of Surfing on the North Shore of Oahu, Hawaii was the 2002 Pipeline Masters.  He managed to inject a Polynesian/Celtic feel into the 2004 Vans Hawaiian Pro poster depicted here. The water holds hidden secrets.

Limited Edition Artist Proof - 120 signed by Artist

Size (inches) - 17" x 22"
Size (mm) - 430 x 560

name: John Doherty - Donegal Fiddler
description:
The most renowned & admired among all the fiddlers of Donegal, John composed a lot of the tunes you'll hear around music sessions in Ireland & indeed the world. He had a unique style of playing which often sounded like 2 fiddles playing at once. John is no longer with us but his music will live on until the end of time. Study his tie & find the happy toucan. 

Limited Edition Print - 600 Signed by artist

Size (inches) - 17 3/4" x 25"
Size (mm) - 450 x 640

name: High Tide Rossnowlagh
description:
This is where Barry grew up & learned to surf. His children Easkey & Rebecca are also avid surfers & can be seen in the background of characters. Study the water to find the hidden fish, birds & dolphin. There are always hidden motifs in Barry's work.

Limited Edition Print - 240 Prints signed by artist

Size (inches) - 13 3/4" x 14 1/2"
Size (mm)     - 350 x 365

name: Ballyshannon Folk Festival 2011 - 'Finbar Furey'
description: Ballyshannon Folk Festival has been running annually since 1978. Over a few pints in Sean Og's Pub the artist was talked into drawing the 1980 poster for the event & has been doing it ever since. Finbar Furey, the subject of the 2011 poster, is a famous piper, banjo player, whistle player, singer ,composer & raconteur. Finbar is proud of his traveller heritage & indeed reflects this in his travels to bring his music to the 4 corners of the globe. A humble & a mighty man! To view the full set of Folk Festival posters right back to 1978 visit www.ballyshannonfolkfestival.com Size (inches) - 14" x 20 1/2" Size (mm) - 360 x 520

name: Intercounties Surf 2011 - 'Invaders Beware'
description:
The Rossnowlagh Intercounties Surfing Contest has been running annually since 1968. Barry took over from his brother Conor creating the poster for the event in the early seventies. The 2011 poster depicts the famous "Peak" in Bundoran about to be invaded by the European Surfing Championships. Some of the older posters are still available - Please contact the artist for details.  

Size (inches) - 12 1/2" x 17 3/4"
Size (mm) - 320 x 450
